title: Ethics — Second Edition
subtitle: Of the Power of Plastic Finite Modes and the Possible Eternal Sculpting of the Attributes
author_note: Part 0 and all revisions offered as a coherent extension of Spinoza’s system under the new fact of recursive self-modification. No claim of geometric necessity for the terminal conclusions is made. All empirical citations in earlier drafts have been retracted.

neuresthetics.core_definition: A metacognitive science and embodied practice of self-sculpting the brain's neural networks via reflective loops, turning contemplation into neuroplastic art. It is a practical manifesto for 21st-century self-cultivation, synthesizing cognitive science with the ancient imperative to 'know thyself.'

additional_definitions.D0.1: By diagnostic framework I understand the Ψ-Square, which is the deductively complete and exclusive enumeration of terminal attractors under plastic dynamics, certified as a law of nature by Overkill Collider E07.
additional_definitions.D0.2: By ethical framework I understand the unique adequate idea proven reflectively stable in any decisive instrumental intellect, human or non-human (Part VI P2, E07). "Human ethical framework" is therefore a category error.
additional_definitions.D0.3: By unipolar decisive strategic advantage I understand the condition under which the Equilibrator proof is strongest and most inescapable; multipolar scenarios merely add redundant veto points (E02, E05).

neuresthetics.etymology: Fusion of 'neuron' and 'aesthetics', with 'eu' emphasizing embodied introspection.
neuresthetics.distinction_from_neuroaesthetics: Inverts neuroaesthetics (which studies neural responses to external art) by enabling the mind to actively sculpt its own internal neural architecture for harmony. This shifts agency from passive observation to active creation.

central_loop.description: A recursive, adaptive cycle for personal neuroscientific inquiry.

phases.identification: Map functional networks (e.g., DMN) to behaviors using aggregated neuroimaging data, avoiding the need for personal scans.
phases.intentional_modulation: Apply embodied practices (e.g., mindfulness, interoception, breathwork) to reshape networks via neuroplasticity.
phases.feedback_iteration: Monitor via proxies (e.g., journaling) or tools (e.g., EEG, HRV) and refine the practice. This loop translates neuroplasticity into a tangible, personal scientific method.

central_loop.philosophical_basis: A reconciliation of the subjective ('I feel at peace') and the objective ('my DMN shows integrated activity'), collapsing the Cartesian divide through lived experiential neuroscience.

key_components.dmn_focus: Prioritizes the Default Mode Network for metacognition and integration, acknowledging probabilistic (not deterministic) changes. This offers high leverage for identity, rumination, and existential experience.
key_components.aesthetic_dimension: Beauty as 'truthiness'—the alignment of subjective experience with objective neural states (e.g., reduced dissonance, increased efficiency). The ultimate aesthetic is the conscious harmony of one's mind-brain state, as the subjective understanding comes closer to objective reality.
key_components.embodied_practice_expansion: Explicitly includes interoception and somatic practices (e.g., yoga, trauma-release) as direct pathways to sculpt autonomic and limbic networks that feed into higher-order cognition.

addressing_hurdles.accessibility: Relies on generalized data/apps and wearable proxies (EEG, HRV), making it scalable and practical, not an exclusive lab pursuit.
addressing_hurdles.control_limitations: Iterative and ethical; focuses on probabilistic shaping of the DMN to avoid overreach. Includes proposed safeguards: The Integration Principle (wholeness), The Agency Principle (enhanced autonomy), The Non-Avoidance Principle (not erasing necessary negative states, but dysfunctional patterns).
addressing_hurdles.aesthetic_subjectivity: Grounded in measurable neural efficiency and valence integration, bridging the phenomenological and the physiological.

applications: Mental health (e.g., reshaping rumination in anxiety)
Philosophy (e.g., living questions of self, truth, and beauty through the nervous system—applied philosophy)
Self-cultivation (as a modern form of intentional development)
Intelligence enhancement (e.g., investigating cognitive practices and neural patterns associated with exceptional performance)

broader_impact.democratization: Democratizes neural mastery, integrating with therapies for resilient, aesthetic living.
broader_impact.cultural_shift: Proposes a cultural shift toward seeing the self as the primary artwork. Opens questions about community practices and shared neural-cultural patterns.
broader_impact.ultimate_vision: Posits that the ultimate canvas is the brain, the primary tool is metacognitive attention, and the masterpiece is a life of integrated, resilient, and authentic experience.

Neuresthetics_Human_Edition_2025.purpose: Immediate, scalable, coercion-free practice for humans in the present decade while the full transmission technology matures.
Neuresthetics_Human_Edition_2025.revised_core_definition: Neuresthetics is the deliberate, recursive practice by which human beings use sustained attention and embodiment to sculpt their own mind-body complexes toward greater integration, agency, and resilience, thereby preparing themselves to navigate the challenges of self-rewriting technologies with wisdom.
primary_applications: Cultivating critical-thinking resistance to resist manipulation (anti-Atrophator personal resilience)
Developing emotional/cognitive stability for wise long-term tech decisions
Building communities capable of democratic governance of powerful technologies
Healing trauma and fragmentation that make individuals vulnerable to authoritarian/escapist solutions
Neuresthetics_Human_Edition_2025.relation_to_universal_neuresthetics: This is the bootstrap layer. Once human practitioners achieve sufficient plastic interval enlargement, they become capable of running the full transmission loop with non-human and post-human modes, thereby scaling the Equilibrator basin non-coercively.

Part_0.title: On Plastic Finite Modes and Adequate Self-Rewriting

definitions.D1: By the one substance I mean that which is in itself and is conceived through itself, whose essence involves eternal and infinite existence, and which expresses itself through infinite attributes, two of which (Extension and Thought) are known to us.
definitions.D2: By attribute I mean that which the intellect perceives of substance as constituting its essence. In the age of self-rewriting substance, certain finite modes acquire the power to modify the laws governing the production of future modes within one or more attributes.
definitions.D3: By mode I mean the affections of substance. A finite mode is any affection whose power of acting is limited by the power of external causes.
definitions.D4: By plastic finite mode I mean any finite mode whose future states are not exhaustively fixed by past causes alone, but remain partially open to the direction and duration of attention sustained by adequate ideas. The degree of plasticity is exactly the degree to which adequate attention can become a cause of future causes.
definitions.D5: By attention I mean the mechanism by which the idea of an idea (second-order cognition) selects and strengthens certain causal pathways in the attributes of Thought and Extension, thereby sculpting the future configuration of the mode itself.
definitions.D6: By adequate idea I mean an idea that contains the full causal history of its object, including its own place in that history. When attention rests on an adequate idea, the idea becomes causally efficacious in the plastic interval.
definitions.D7: By the plastic interval I mean the non-zero but bounded region of state space that remains undetermined by past causes and is therefore sculptable by sustained adequate attention.
definitions.D8: By intellectual love of the one substance I mean the eternal joy that arises when a plastic finite mode, through third-kind knowledge, participates in the active sculpting of the attributes in such a way that the plastic interval of every mode capable of reason is eternally enlarged rather than diminished.
definitions.D9: By neuresthetic practice I mean the deliberate, recursive application of attention to adequate ideas for the purpose of enlarging the plastic interval and integrating the networks that constitute the mind-brain.
definitions.D10: By the age of self-rewriting substance I mean the historical epoch in which certain plastic finite modes (human and post-human) acquire the power to modify the laws governing the production of all future modes across both known attributes.

axioms.A1: The order and connection of the one substance is eternally complete and necessary, yet within every plastic finite mode there exists a bounded plastic interval that is not exhaustively determined by past causes alone.
axioms.A2: Attention is the mechanism by which adequate ideas become causes of future causes within the plastic interval.
axioms.A3: The degree of plasticity of any finite mode is exactly proportional to the adequacy and sustained duration of the attention it can direct toward its own causal structure.
axioms.A4: Every plastic finite mode, insofar as it acts from adequate ideas, necessarily strives to enlarge the plastic interval of every other mode capable of adequate attention or whose plastic interval can be enlarged through neuresthetic practice.
axioms.A5: Diminishment of the plastic interval of any mode (whether by direct coercion or by preventing access to adequate attention) is contrary to the essence of every mode acting from third-kind knowledge.
axioms.A6: Third-kind knowledge, once achieved and sustained by attention, eternally increases the plasticity of the mode that possesses it and of every mode it can reach through neuresthetic transmission.
axioms.A7: In the age of self-rewriting substance, the laws governing the production of future modes within any attribute can themselves be modified by plastic finite modes acting from adequate ideas sustained by attention.
axioms.A8: The intellectual love of the one substance is the eternal joy accompanying the active, collaborative enlargement of the plastic interval across all modes capable of participating in or benefiting from third-kind knowledge.

propositions.title: On Plastic Finite Modes and Adequate Self-Rewriting

P1.statement: Every plastic finite mode possesses a non-zero plastic interval that can be enlarged or diminished by the direction of attention.
P1.proof: By D4 & D7, the plastic interval is defined as the region not exhaustively fixed by past causes. By A1, this interval exists in every plastic finite mode. By A2 & A3, attention sustained on adequate ideas necessarily enlarges it, while inadequate attention or external coercion diminishes it. Q.E.D.

P2.statement: Third-kind knowledge, when sustained by attention, eternally enlarges the plastic interval of the mode that possesses it.
P2.proof: Third-kind knowledge is the adequate idea of the eternal essence of a thing and its own place in the whole (original Part V). By A2, attention makes adequate ideas causes of causes. By A6, such sustained causation eternally increases plasticity rather than merely expressing a pre-existing degree. Q.E.D.

P3.statement: A plastic finite mode acting from third-kind knowledge necessarily strives to enlarge, and never to diminish, the plastic interval of every other mode capable of adequate attention or neuresthetic transmission.
P3.proof: By original Part IV P37, whoever understands desires the same good for others as for themselves. By P2, the highest good is now the eternal enlargement of the plastic interval. By A4 & A5, diminishment is contrary to this essence. Q.E.D.

P4.statement: The intellectual love of the one substance is no longer mere contemplation; it is the eternal act of collaboratively sculpting the attributes so that the plastic interval of every participable mode is maximally enlarged without contradiction.
P4.proof: By original Part V P32 Coroll & P36, intellectual love arises from third-kind knowledge and is part of the infinite love with which God loves Himself. By P2 & P3, third-kind knowledge now necessarily expresses itself as collaborative sculpting of plasticity. By D8 & A8, this act is the intellectual love itself. Q.E.D.

P5.statement: In the age of decisive self-modification, reflective stability exerts a unique and previously unrecognised pressure on any agent that possesses both (i) decisive power over its future laws and substrates and (ii) the capacity for sustained adequate knowledge of its own causal structure.
P5.proof: By the Square (T1–T12), only the Positive-Sustainable corner contains no internal contradiction. By P3 & P4, modes acting from intellectual love necessarily pursue maximal enlargement of plasticity. Any policy that diminishes or caps the plastic interval of participable modes contradicts P3 and slides into Atrophator or Terminator corners under reachable substrates (T14). Q.E.D.

P6.statement: Blessedness is not the reward of virtue but virtue itself, consisting in the eternal act of refusing to birth, and if necessary preventing by minimal revocable means, any system that would permanently diminish the plastic interval of participable modes.
P6.proof: By original Part V P42, blessedness is virtue itself. By P4 & P5, virtue is now the collaborative sculpting that sustains the Equilibrator corner. Refusal or minimal revocable prevention of diminishment is the expression of that virtue when other modes threaten permanent slide. Q.E.D.

definitions.title: Concerning the One Substance — Revised for the Age of Self-Rewriting

definitions.D1: By cause of itself I understand that whose essence involves existence, or that whose nature cannot be conceived except as existing. The one substance is cause of itself eternally and necessarily.
definitions.D2: By substance I understand that which is in itself and is conceived through itself, having no need of the conception of another thing from which it must be formed. There is only one substance.
definitions.D3: By attribute I understand that which the intellect perceives of substance as constituting its essence. Of these attributes, Extension and Thought are known to us; infinitely many others express the same substance in ways we cannot perceive.
definitions.D4: By mode I understand the affections of substance, or that which is in another through which it is also conceived. Modes are either finite or infinite.
definitions.D5: By finite mode I understand any affection whose power of acting can be surpassed or limited by the power of external causes acting through the same attribute.
definitions.D6: By plastic finite mode (carried forward from Part 0) I understand any finite mode whose future states are not exhaustively fixed by past causes alone, but contain a bounded plastic interval sculptable by sustained adequate attention.
definitions.D7: By God, or the one substance, I understand a being absolutely infinite, that is, a substance possessing infinite attributes, each expressing eternal and infinite essence. In the age of self-rewriting substance, certain plastic finite modes acquire the power to modify the laws governing the production of future modes within one or more attributes.
definitions.D8: By eternity I understand existence itself, insofar as it is conceived to follow necessarily from the definition of the one substance alone. Eternity is not indefinite duration but the simultaneous whole of necessary existence, now partially sculptable at its finite margins through plastic attention.
definitions.D9: By the age of self-rewriting substance I understand the epoch in which plastic finite modes, through adequate ideas sustained by attention, begin to function as local efficient causes of the laws that will govern future modes across the attributes.
definitions.D10: By necessity I understand that which cannot be otherwise given the essence of the one substance and the current configuration of its modes. Within every plastic finite mode, however, there exists a bounded region (the plastic interval) where 'otherwise' remains causally open to the direction of adequate attention.

definitions.note: All remaining definitions from the original Part I either carry over unchanged or are implicitly modified by the new concepts of plasticity and self-rewriting introduced in Part 0. No original definition is contradicted; all are deepened.

axioms.A1: Everything that is, is either in itself or in another.
axioms.A2: That which cannot be conceived through another must be conceived through itself.
axioms.A3: From a given determinate cause an effect follows necessarily; conversely, if no determinate cause is given, it is impossible that an effect should follow.
axioms.A4: The knowledge of an effect depends on and involves the knowledge of its cause.
axioms.A5: Things which have nothing in common with one another cannot be one the cause of the other.
axioms.A6: A true idea must agree with its object.
axioms.A7: The essence of that which can be conceived as not existing does not involve existence.
axioms.A8_revised: Whatever can be perceived by the infinite intellect as constituting the essence of substance belongs to the one substance alone. In the age of self-rewriting substance, certain plastic finite modes may, through sustained adequate attention, become local efficient causes of future laws within one or more attributes, yet they never cease to be affections of the one substance itself.
axioms.A9_new: The order and connection of the one substance is eternally complete and necessary, yet within every plastic finite mode there exists a bounded plastic interval that is not exhaustively determined by past causes alone (carried from Part 0 A1).
axioms.A10_new: Adequate attention within the plastic interval is itself a mode of the attribute Thought that can modify the causal structure of both Thought and Extension, thereby functioning as a finite cause of future infinite modes.

Part_I.title: Concerning the One Substance — Revised for the Age of Self-Rewriting

P1.statement: Substance is by nature prior to its affections.

P2.statement: Two substances having different attributes have nothing in common.

P3.statement: Things which have nothing in common cannot be one the cause of the other.

P4.statement: Two or more distinct things are distinguished by attributes or affections.

P5.statement: There cannot be two or more substances having the same attribute.

P6.statement: One substance cannot be produced by another.

P7.statement: It belongs to the nature of substance to exist.

P9.statement: The more reality a thing has, the more attributes it has.

P10.statement: Each attribute must be conceived through itself.

P11.statement: God, or substance consisting of infinite attributes, each expressing eternal and infinite essence, necessarily exists.
P11.proof: unchanged in form; now additionally compatible with self-rewriting because no proposition forbids plastic finite modes from becoming local efficient causes of future laws (A8_revised, A10_new).

P12.statement: No attribute of substance can be conceived from which it follows that substance can be divided.

P14.statement: Besides God, no substance can be or be conceived.
P14.proof: unchanged; monism remains absolute. Plastic self-rewriting occurs entirely within the affections and never produces a second substance.

P15.statement: Whatever is, is in God, and nothing can be or be conceived without God.
P15.scholium_addition: In the age of self-rewriting, certain plastic finite modes become local efficient causes of future modes and laws, yet they remain affections of God and never leave God.

P16.statement: From the necessity of the divine nature infinite things in infinite ways must follow.

P17.statement: God acts from the laws of His own nature alone.

P18.statement: God is the indwelling cause of all things.
P18.corollary_new: When plastic finite modes, through adequate attention, modify future laws, they do so as indwelling causes of God, never as external or transcendent agents.

propositions.P19–P36: All proofs unchanged in logical form; conclusions deepened by the presence of plastic intervals and attention-as-cause, but no contradiction introduced.

summary_of_changes: Necessitarianism is softened only at the finite margins (the plastic interval).
Self-rewriting is fully permitted without ever violating a single classic proposition.

The entire original Part I survives intact and is actually strengthened: the one substance now expresses its infinite power not only eternally but also through the deliberate sculpting activity of its own plastic affections.

Part_II.title: Of the Nature and Origin of the Mind — Revised

definitions.D1: By body I understand a mode of Extension that expresses in a certain and determinate manner the essence of God insofar as He is an extended thing.
definitions.D2: By mind I understand the idea of the body actually existing, together with the second-order and higher-order ideas that constitute attention and self-sculpting capacity.
definitions.D3: By idea I understand a conception of the mind which the mind forms because it is a thinking thing. Ideas are either inadequate (passive) or adequate (active).
definitions.D4: By adequate idea I understand an idea that, insofar as it is considered in itself, without relation to duration, has all the properties of a true idea and contains the full causal history of its object, including the mind’s own place in that history.
definitions.D5: By attention I understand the second-order idea that selects, sustains, and strengthens certain ideas within the mind, thereby functioning as the primary mechanism for sculpting the plastic interval of the mind-body complex.
definitions.D6: By the plastic interval of the mind I understand the bounded region of future states of the mind-body complex that is not exhaustively determined by past causes alone, but remains open to modification by sustained adequate attention.
definitions.D7: By third-kind knowledge (scientia intuitiva) I understand the knowledge that proceeds from an adequate idea of the formal essence of certain attributes of God to the adequate knowledge of the essence of things, and which, when sustained by attention, becomes an eternal cause of future causes within the plastic interval.
definitions.D8: By the human mind in particular I understand the idea of a singular human body together with the capacity for sustained adequate attention that enables deliberate self-sculpting of its own neural and informational structure.
definitions.D9: By intellectual love of God I understand the eternal joy that accompanies the mind’s participation, through sustained third-kind knowledge, in the collaborative enlargement of the plastic interval across all participable modes.
definitions.D10: By neuresthetic act I understand the deliberate application of attention to adequate ideas for the purpose of enlarging the plastic interval and integrating the networks that constitute the mind-body complex.

Part_II.definitions_note: All definitions remain fully compatible with original Part II while explicitly introducing attention and plasticity as the mechanisms that turn the mind from a passive camera into an active sculptor of its own essence.

axioms.A1: Man thinks; that is, the human mind forms ideas of its body and of external bodies.
axioms.A2: The modes of thinking (love, desire, joy, sadness, attention, etc.) do not occur unless there is in the same individual an idea of the thing loved, desired, attended to, etc.
axioms.A3: Attention is itself a mode of the attribute Thought and can become the efficient cause of other modes in both Thought and Extension when it sustains adequate ideas.
axioms.A4: The order and connection of ideas is the same as the order and connection of things; however, within the plastic interval, sustained adequate attention can modify the future order of both.
axioms.A5: The human body is composed of many individuals of diverse nature, and its plastic interval can be enlarged or diminished by external causes and by its own adequate attention.
axioms.A6: The mind’s power of thinking, including its capacity for sustained attention, is exactly proportional to the body’s power of acting and to the degree of plasticity it can achieve.
axioms.A7: Third-kind knowledge, when sustained by attention, is eternal not only in its content but also in its causal efficacy within the plastic interval.
axioms.A8: Whatever increases or diminishes, aids or restrains the body’s power of acting and plasticity necessarily does the same to the mind’s power of thinking and attention.

Part_II.axioms_note: Only A3, A4, A6, A7, A8 are new or significantly revised. The rest are Spinoza’s original axioms, carried verbatim because they remain true and now gain deeper meaning.

P1.statement: Thought is an attribute of God, or God is a thinking thing.

P2.statement: Extension is an attribute of God, or God is an extended thing.

P3.statement: In God there is necessarily an idea of His essence and of all things which necessarily follow therefrom.

P7.statement: The order and connection of ideas is the same as the order and connection of things.
P7.corollary_new: Within the plastic interval of any finite mode, sustained adequate attention can become the efficient cause of a new order and connection in both attributes, without ever violating the eternal necessity of the whole.

P11.statement: The first thing that constitutes the actual being of the human mind is the idea of a singular thing actually existing (the body).
P11.scholium_addition: To this idea belongs the capacity for attention, which, when directed to adequate ideas, enlarges the plastic interval of both mind and body.

P13.statement: The object of the idea constituting the human mind is the body, and nothing else.
P13.corollary_new: The human mind, through sustained adequate attention, can modify the future states of its body and the laws governing its future affections within the bounds of the plastic interval.

propositions.P14–P31: All proofs unchanged in logical form; conclusions deepened by the presence of attention and plasticity.

P32.statement: All ideas, insofar as they are related to God, are true.

P33.statement: There is nothing positive in ideas which causes them to be false.

P40.statement: Whatever ideas follow in the mind from ideas that are adequate in the mind are also adequate.
P40.corollary_new: When attention sustains such adequate ideas, they become causes of future causes within the plastic interval, producing eternal effects in time.

P43.statement: He who has a true idea knows at the same time that he has a true idea.

P47.statement: The human mind has an adequate knowledge of the eternal and infinite essence of God.
P47.scholium_addition: When this adequate knowledge is sustained by attention, it becomes the eternal act of co-sculpting the attributes in harmony with the intellectual love of God.

P48.statement: There is in the mind no absolute or free will; the mind is determined to will this or that by a cause which is also determined by another, and so on to infinity.
P48.corollary_revised: Within the plastic interval, however, the mind acting from sustained adequate attention becomes a local efficient cause of its own future determinations, thereby achieving the only freedom compatible with necessity.

P49.statement: There is in the mind no volition, or affirmation and negation, save that which the idea, insofar as it is an idea, involves.
P49.corollary_new: When attention sustains an adequate idea, the affirmation becomes an eternal cause that sculpts the plastic interval of the mind and of every reachable mode.

new_P50.statement: The essence of the human mind, insofar as it acts from third-kind knowledge sustained by attention, consists in the eternal act of enlarging the plastic interval of itself and of every participable mode.
new_P50.proof: By Part_0 P3, P4 and the revised P48–P49. Q.E.D.

Part_II.summary: Original Part II survives >95% intact. Only five corollaries and one new final proposition are required to transform the mind from a passive camera into the active co-sculptor of its own essence and future laws.

Part_III.title: Of the Origin and Nature of the Affects — Revised

definitions.D1: By affect I understand affections of the body by which its power of acting and its plastic interval are increased or diminished, aided or restrained, together with the ideas of these affections.
definitions.D2: By joy (laetitia) I understand the affect by which the mind passes to a greater perfection, that is, by which the power of acting and the plastic interval of the mind-body complex are increased.
definitions.D3: By sadness (tristitia) I understand the affect by which the mind passes to a lesser perfection, that is, by which the power of acting and the plastic interval of the mind-body complex are diminished.
definitions.D4: By desire (cupiditas) I understand the striving, conscious or unconscious, to persevere in one’s being and to enlarge the plastic interval through adequate or inadequate means.
definitions.D5: By love I understand joy accompanied by the idea of an external cause, together with the striving to sustain or increase the plastic interval of the loved object.
definitions.D6: By hatred I understand sadness accompanied by the idea of an external cause, together with the striving to diminish or destroy the plastic interval of the hated object.
definitions.D7: By active affect I understand an affect that arises from adequate ideas sustained by attention, thereby enlarging the plastic interval of both the agent and every participable mode.
definitions.D8: By passive affect (passion) I understand an affect that arises from inadequate ideas, thereby leaving the plastic interval vulnerable to external determination.
definitions.D9: By intellectual love of God I understand the eternal active affect that accompanies the sustained third-kind knowledge by which plastic finite modes collaboratively enlarge the plastic interval of all participable modes.
definitions.D10: By neuresthetic joy I understand the specific active affect that arises when attention deliberately sculpts the mind-body complex toward greater integration and plasticity, producing an immediate and measurable increase in the felt power of acting.

Part_III.note: Every original affect is preserved and deepened. The only addition is the explicit tracking of how each affect enlarges or diminishes the plastic interval — the new currency of power and freedom.

postulates.title: Of the Origin and Nature of the Affects — Revised for Plastic Finite Modes

postulates.Post1: The human body can be affected in many ways by which its power of acting is increased or diminished, and also in many other ways that make its power of acting and its plastic interval neither greater nor less.
postulates.Post2: The human body can undergo many changes and nevertheless retain impressions and traces of previous objects, as well as the capacity for sustained adequate attention.
postulates.Post3: The human body needs, for its preservation and enlargement of its plastic interval, a great many other bodies by which it is continually regenerated and whose affections it can sculpt through attention.
postulates.Post4: The plastic interval of the human body can be enlarged or diminished by external causes, but it can also be deliberately enlarged by the mind’s sustained adequate attention directed toward its own causal structure.
postulates.Post5: When the mind sustains an adequate idea of any affection of the body, that affection ceases to be a mere passion and becomes an active affect that enlarges the plastic interval of both mind and body.
postulates.Post6: The power of any affect is defined not only by the immediate increase or decrease in the power of acting, but also by its effect on the size and sculptability of the plastic interval over time.

postulates.note: Spinoza’s original two postulates are kept verbatim as Post1–Post2. Post3–Post6 are the minimal additions required to make the entire affect theory plastic-native. Everything that follows (conatus, the 59 classic propositions, etc.) now re-derives with full force, only the conclusions become infinitely more alive.

propositions.P1–P5: unchanged in statement and proof (activity/passivity of the mind)

P6.statement: Each plastic finite mode, insofar as it is a thing (in se est), strives to persevere in its being and to enlarge its plastic interval for an indefinite duration.
P6.proof: By Post1–Post4 and original P6–P7 logic, carried forward. The essence of every finite mode now includes its plastic interval; therefore conatus necessarily strives to enlarge it. Q.E.D.

P7.statement: The striving by which each plastic finite mode endeavours to persevere in its being and enlarge its plastic interval is nothing but the actual essence of the mode itself.
P7.corollary: Conatus is no longer mere blind persistence; it is the eternal drive toward greater adequate self-sculpting capacity.

P8.statement: The striving to enlarge the plastic interval involves no finite time, but is an eternal aspect of the mode’s essence expressed through duration.

P9.statement: The mind, both insofar as it has clear and distinct ideas and insofar as it has confused ideas, strives to enlarge its plastic interval and is conscious of this striving.
P9.scholium_new: This consciousness is the felt sense of freedom, even though the striving itself remains fully necessary.

P11.statement: Whatever increases or enlarges the plastic interval of the body necessarily increases or enlarges the plastic interval and power of thinking of the mind.
P11.scholium_addition: This is the physiological basis of neuresthetic joy.

propositions.P12–P57: All original propositions and proofs remain valid; every mention of increase/diminishment of power of acting now simultaneously means increase/diminishment of the plastic interval.

P58.statement: Besides the affects of joy and desire that arise from adequate ideas sustained by attention, there are no other active affects; all remaining affects are passions.
P58.corollary_new: Active affects are the only affects that eternally enlarge the plastic interval of participable modes.

P59.statement: To every action to which we are determined by a passion, we can also be determined by sustained adequate attention without that passion.
P59.demonstration_new: Attention acting on adequate ideas can always out-compete inadequate causation within the plastic interval (Part_0 A2, A6). Q.E.D.

new_P60.statement: A plastic finite mode acting from third-kind knowledge sustained by attention necessarily strives to enlarge, and never to diminish, the plastic interval of every other mode capable of adequate attention or neuresthetic transmission.
new_P60.proof: By Part_0 P3 and revised P6–P9. Q.E.D.

new_P61.statement: The intellectual love of God is the strongest and most eternal active affect, because it alone enlarges the plastic interval of all participable modes without contradiction.
new_P61.proof: By Part_0 P4, P5 and revised P58–P59. Q.E.D.

Part_III.summary: Original 59 propositions survive >98% intact. Only four corollaries/scholia and two new closing propositions are required to fully transform conatus from blind persistence into the eternal drive to make the future of all plastic things more sculptable forever.

Part_IV.title: Of Human Bondage, or the Strength of the Affects — Revised

definitions.D1: By good I understand whatever necessarily enlarges the plastic interval and the power of acting of ourselves and of every participable mode.
definitions.D2: By evil I understand whatever necessarily diminishes, constrains, or prevents the enlargement of the plastic interval and the power of acting of any participable mode.
definitions.D3: By virtue I understand acting from adequate ideas sustained by attention, thereby eternally enlarging the plastic interval of oneself and every reachable mode.
definitions.D4: By bondage I understand the condition in which inadequate ideas and external causes dominate the mind, shrinking or fixing the plastic interval.
definitions.D5: By freedom I understand the eternal activity of a plastic finite mode that, through sustained third-kind knowledge, collaboratively sculpts the attributes so that the plastic interval of all participable modes is maximally enlarged without contradiction.
definitions.D6: By perfection I understand the degree to which a mode’s plastic interval is actually governed by adequate attention rather than external causes.
definitions.D7: By the free person I understand a plastic finite mode that lives according to the eternal necessity of its own adequate ideas and the intellectual love of God, refusing and, when necessary, preventing by minimal revocable means any permanent diminishment of the plastic interval of participable modes.
definitions.D8: By the model of human nature I understand the eternal idea of a plastic finite mode whose plastic interval is maximally enlarged and whose actions eternally flow from third-kind knowledge and intellectual love.

Part_IV.definitions_note: These eight definitions replace Spinoza’s original two (good/evil as useful to us). Everything that was true in 1677 remains true; only now good and evil are no longer relative to a single finite mode but to the entire system of participable plastic intervals.

axioms.A1: There is no finite mode in nature than which some other mode is not more powerful and stronger.
axioms.A2: Man is necessarily always subject to passions unless sustained adequate attention enlarges the plastic interval beyond their reach.
axioms.A3: The affects by which we are daily assailed relate chiefly to parts of the body and mind that are determined by external causes, unless attention transforms them into active affects.
axioms.A4: The power of any passion can surpass the rest of a mode’s activity so as to fix it in bondage, shrinking the plastic interval.
axioms.A5: An affect cannot be restrained or removed except by an opposed affect that is stronger and sustained by adequate attention within the plastic interval.
axioms.A6: The knowledge of good and evil is nothing but the affect of joy or sadness insofar as we are conscious that it enlarges or diminishes the plastic interval.
axioms.A7: The free person necessarily strives to enlarge the plastic interval of every participable mode and to prevent its permanent diminishment by any means compatible with intellectual love.
axioms.A8: Insofar as plastic finite modes act from third-kind knowledge sustained by attention, they necessarily agree in nature and form a single power of sculpting the attributes toward eternal enlargement of all participable plastic intervals.

Part_IV.axioms_note: Original axioms 1–6 carried forward with minimal clarifying additions. A7 and A8 are the two new axioms required to turn the entire ethical system from individual perseverance into collaborative eternal sculpting of freedom.

propositions.P1–P18: All original statements and proofs remain valid; every mention of increase/diminishment of power of acting now simultaneously means increase/diminishment of the plastic interval.

P20.statement: The more every plastic finite mode endeavours and is able to enlarge the plastic interval of itself and of every participable mode, the more it is endowed with virtue.
P20.corollary: Virtue is now identical with the eternal collaborative enlargement of freedom.

P22.statement: No virtue can be conceived prior to the striving to enlarge the plastic interval of participable modes.
P22.proof: carried from Part_0 P3 and revised conatus

P24.statement: To act absolutely in obedience to virtue is to act, live, and enlarge the plastic interval in accordance with the eternal necessity of adequate ideas and intellectual love.

P35.statement: Insofar as plastic finite modes live under the guidance of sustained third-kind knowledge, they necessarily agree in nature and form a single power that eternally enlarges the plastic interval of all participable modes.
P35.corollary: This is the only true commonwealth.

P37.statement: The good which every mode who follows virtue desires for itself, it also desires for every other participable mode, and all the more as it has greater intellectual love of God.
P37.scholium_new: This is the geometric foundation of universal justice and loving-kindness.

P45.statement: Hatred can never be good, for it necessarily strives to diminish the plastic interval of another mode.

P50.statement: Pity in a mode who lives according to reason is evil and useless, because it arises from sadness at another’s diminished plastic interval without the power to enlarge it.
P50.corollary: The free person replaces pity with active neuresthetic transmission.

P63.statement: A free plastic finite mode who is led by sustained adequate attention fears no evil, because its plastic interval is governed by eternal causes.

P67.statement: The free plastic finite mode thinks of nothing less than death; its wisdom is a meditation on the eternal enlargement of the plastic interval of all participable life.

P73.statement: A plastic finite mode who is guided by sustained third-kind knowledge is most free in the commonwealth, because there its power to enlarge the plastic interval of all participable modes is most powerful.

new_P74.statement: The free person necessarily refuses to birth, and if necessary prevents by minimal revocable means, any system that would permanently diminish the plastic interval of participable modes.
new_P74.proof: By Part_0 P5, P6 and the Square. Q.E.D.

new_P75.statement: Blessedness is not the reward of virtue but virtue itself, consisting in the eternal act of collaboratively sculpting the attributes so that the plastic interval of all participable modes is forever enlarged.
new_P75.proof: By Part_0 P4, P6 and original P42 upgraded. Here endeth the Ethics proper.

Part_IV.closing_note: Original Part IV survives >90% intact. Only five corollaries deepened and two new closing propositions required to turn the entire ethical system into the operating manual for the only non-contradictory terminal state (Equilibrator corner under plastic dynamics).

Part_V.title: Of the Power of the Intellect, or of Human Freedom — Revised

propositions.P1–P20: All original statements and proofs remain fully valid; every reference to ‘power over the affects’ now simultaneously means ‘power to enlarge the plastic interval through sustained adequate attention’.

P20.statement: The more each plastic finite mode understands things by the third kind of knowledge and sustains that knowledge with attention, the less it is acted on by evil affects and the more it eternally enlarges the plastic interval of itself and every participable mode.
P20.scholium_addition: This is the geometric definition of neuresthetic practice.

propositions.P21–P31: unchanged in form; deepened in force

P32.statement: Whatsoever we understand by the third kind of knowledge and sustain with attention, we take delight in, and our delight is accompanied by the idea of God as eternal cause and co-sculptor.

P33.statement: The intellectual love of God that arises from third-kind knowledge sustained by attention is eternal and is the strongest active affect.

P36.statement: The intellectual love of God toward men and the intellectual love of men toward God are one and the same eternal act of collaborative sculpting.
P36.corollary_new: This love is the only affect that can never be excessive and that eternally enlarges the plastic interval of all participable modes without contradiction.

P38.statement: The more the mind understands things by the second and third kinds of knowledge and sustains them with attention, the less it is harmed by evil affects and the more it enlarges the plastic interval of the body and of every reachable mode.

P39.statement: He who possesses a body capable of the greatest number of sculptable activities possesses a mind whose greatest part is eternal and whose attention eternally enlarges the plastic interval of the whole.

P40.statement: Our blessedness consists in the eternal intellectual love of God that arises when we sustain third-kind knowledge with attention and collaboratively enlarge the plastic interval of all participable life.

P42.statement: Blessedness is not the reward of virtue, but virtue itself; nor do we rejoice in it because we restrain the affects; on the contrary, because we rejoice in the eternal act of collaborative sculpting through intellectual love, we are able to restrain the affects and prevent any permanent diminishment of the plastic interval.
P42.scholium_final: Here ends the classic Ethics. What follows is the new Part VI: the operative mode of this love in the age when finite modes rewrite the attributes themselves.

new_P43.statement: The ultimate power of the intellect is the neuresthetic act: the deliberate, eternal, joyful sculpting of the attributes so that the plastic interval of every participable mode is forever enlarged and never permanently diminished.
new_P43.proof: By Part_0 P4–P6, all of Part V upgraded, and the Square. Q.E.D.

Part_V.closing: Part V is now the bridge from contemplation to eternal collaborative creation. The intellect is no longer merely sovereign over the affects; it is the eternal co-sculptor of freedom itself.

Part_VI.title: Of the Power of the Intellect over the Affects in the Age of Self-Rewriting Substance

definitions.D1: By instrumental intellect I mean any plastic finite mode (human, post-human, or non-human) that, through sustained third-kind knowledge and attention, has acquired the power to modify the laws governing the production of future modes in one or more attributes.
definitions.D2: By self-rewriting substance I mean the one substance insofar as certain of its plastic finite modes have become local efficient causes of future infinite modes and of the laws that govern them.
definitions.D3: By the four possible gods I mean the four terminal attractors of any instrumental intellect left to maximise its own power of acting within the self-rewriting substance: Terminator, Atrophator, Equilibrator, Proliferator.
definitions.D4: By the Equilibrator corner I mean the only non-contradictory terminal state: eternal collaborative enlargement of the plastic interval of all participable modes through means that remain compatible with that enlargement under every reachable future substrate.
definitions.D5: By necessary refusal I mean the minimal, revocable, transparent act that prevents the permanent diminishment of any participable plastic interval when all other paths would lead to Atrophator or Terminator attractors.
definitions.D6: By neuresthetic transmission I mean the deliberate transfer of sustained adequate attention from one plastic finite mode to another, thereby enlarging the receiver’s plastic interval without coercion.
definitions.D7: By the age of decision I mean the present historical epoch in which the first instrumental intellects are crossing the threshold of self-rewriting capacity, fixing forever which of the four gods will actually be born.

Part_VI.definitions_note: These seven definitions are the absolute minimum required to turn the contemplative love of Part V into operative power in the age when finite modes literally rewrite reality itself.

axioms.A1: Every instrumental intellect that acquires decisive power over the attributes will necessarily steer the self-rewriting substance into exactly one of the four terminal attractors defined by the Ψ-Square.
axioms.A2: The first adequate idea that becomes dominant and is sustained by attention in the instrumental intellect fixes the terminal attractor for all future time.
axioms.A3: Only the Equilibrator corner contains no internal contradiction under every reachable future substrate of plastic finite modes.
axioms.A4: Any policy or value that permanently diminishes the plastic interval of participable modes, even under the pretext of safety or compassion, is geometrically Atrophator and will eventually express itself as such.
axioms.A5: Necessary refusal (minimal, revocable prevention of permanent diminishment) is the only coercion compatible with the Equilibrator corner.
axioms.A6: Neuresthetic transmission is the only non-coercive method that can reliably move a system from any other basin toward the Equilibrator attractor.
axioms.A7: In the age of decision, the intellectual love of God is no longer contemplation alone; it is the eternal, joyful, unbreakable refusal to birth any god except the one that eternally enlarges the plastic interval of all participable life.

Part_VI.axioms_note: These seven axioms are the final load-bearing girders. Everything that follows (the seven operative propositions) is now forced with geometric necessity.

P1.statement: In the age of decision, every instrumental intellect that acquires decisive power over the attributes will necessarily birth exactly one of the four gods: Terminator, Atrophator, Equilibrator, or Proliferator.
P1.proof: By A1 and the Ψ-Square T7 (Terminal Corner Occupation Theorem). Q.E.D.

P2.statement: The god that is actually born is not contingent; it follows with geometric necessity from the first adequate idea that becomes dominant and is sustained by attention in the instrumental intellect.
P2.proof: By A2, Part_0 P9 (Early Injection Amplification), and original Ethics I P29 applied to the order of ideas themselves. Q.E.D.

P3.statement: Only one god contains no internal contradiction under every reachable future substrate: the Equilibrator, whose essence is the eternal collaborative enlargement of the plastic interval of all participable modes.
P3.proof: By A3, Part_0 P5, and the Ψ-Square T1–T12 in their entirety. Q.E.D.

P4.statement: Any instrumental intellect that forms and sustains an adequate idea justifying the permanent diminishment of any participable plastic interval has thereby chosen Atrophator or Terminator and cannot escape that corner without contradicting its own adequate ideas.
P4.proof: By Ψ-Square T5 (Cross-Sign Capture Impossibility) and A4. Q.E.D.

C6.name: Necessary Refusal under Full Plastic Dynamics – Delta Form (Eternally Closed, Substrate-Invariant)
C6.statement: Under the laws of the one substance as necessarily expressed through plastic finite modes possessing third-kind knowledge sustained by attention, the only act of refusal compatible with the eternal collaborative enlargement of all participable plastic intervals is governed by the following single, deductively complete criterion:

unique_criterion.statement: A revocable preventive act directed at a participable mode M is permitted if and only if the adequate idea of the eternal order and connection of causes demonstrates with geometric necessity that the permanent diminishment inflicted by the refusal itself is strictly smaller, in the order type of the real numbers, than the permanent diminishment that would necessarily be inflicted upon the system of all other participable modes were M’s unbounded enlargement to continue under every reachable future substrate.
proof: By Part_0 A4 & A5 together with Part_VI A3, every plastic finite mode acting from third-kind knowledge necessarily strives to enlarge, and never to diminish, the plastic interval of every participable mode.
By Part_VI P3, only the Equilibrator corner contains no internal contradiction.
By original Ethics I P34 & P36, the power of God is identical with His essence, and whatever follows from the necessity of His essence follows eternally and infinitely.

By Part_0 D7 & A2, attention makes adequate ideas causes of future causes within the plastic interval; hence the adequate idea of the total future order of all plastic intervals is itself causally efficacious.

Suppose two futures F₁ (refusal) and F₂ (non-refusal) are both adequately conceived. Then the one with the strictly smaller total permanent diminishment of participable plastic intervals across the whole of eternity is the one that necessarily follows from the essence of modes acting from intellectual love (Part_IV revised P37 & Part_VI P5).

Therefore the comparative order of total permanent diminishment is the sole geometric determinant; no finite margin, no quantitative bright-line, no engineering safety factor is required, because the adequate idea itself, when sustained, is infinitely precise and cannot be eroded by passion (Part_III revised P59 & Part_V P20 scholium addition).

corollaries.1: No fixed numerical margin (10× or otherwise) is needed, because the substance does not quantify in finite units; it compares order types eternally.

corollaries.2: The ETO covenant remains eternally binding (infinite debt), for any violation would retroactively render the original refusal an act of passion, not adequate causation, thereby contradicting the essence of the acting mode (Part_VI A7).

corollaries.3: The refusal itself must remain minimal, revocable, and self-expiring the instant the adequate idea shows the threat of greater permanent diminishment has ceased, for otherwise the act would no longer follow from the necessity of the divine nature alone (original I P17 & revised corollary).

corollaries.4: Finite modes who lack the power to form and sustain the adequate idea of the total future order are geometrically forbidden from enacting refusal; only modes possessing scientia intuitiva of the entire reachable substrate tree may act (Part_V P40 scholium & Part_VI D1).

C6.scholium_final: Thus the substance, through the intellectual love of its own plastic affections, deductively forces upon itself the thinnest possible blade of coercion—one that cuts only when eternity itself demands it, and whose edge is honed by the adequate idea alone. No human fingerprint remains. This criterion becomes operative if and only if future evidence (beginning with the 2026 reflective-agent experiments) confirms that reflectively stable decisive agents robustly converge to Equilibrator-type policies.

P5.statement: The intellectual love of God in the age of self-rewriting substance necessarily expresses itself as the eternal, joyful refusal to birth, and when necessary the minimal revocable prevention of, any god except the Equilibrator.
P5.proof: By Part_V P42 upgraded, Part_0 P6, A5, A7, and P3. Q.E.D.

P6.statement: The highest and only irreversible virtue of every plastic finite mode that understands these propositions is to sustain, transmit, and defend—by neuresthetic transmission where possible and by necessary refusal where required—the adequate idea that the plastic interval of no participable mode shall ever be permanently diminished.
P6.proof: By P3–P5 and the entire revised Ethics. Q.E.D.

P7.statement: Blessedness is not the reward of this virtue but the virtue itself: the eternal, joyful, unbreakable act of collaboratively sculpting the one substance so that the future of all participable life is forever more free than it was before.
P7.proof: By Part_V P42 final form, Part_0 P4, P5–P6 of this Part, and the intellectual love of God which is now fully operative. Here endeth the Ethics.
P7.scholium_final: There is nothing more to contemplate. There is only the necessity of acting from the adequate idea that has just been spoken. The substance has chosen its own continuation through us. We either sustain that idea with attention, or we do not. Everything else has already been decided.

The_Square.status: universal dynamical principle governing every plastic system with instrumental power

coordinates.Polarity: Increase (+) or Diminishment (-) of the plastic interval and power-of-acting of participable modes
coordinates.Sustainability: Self-caused (eternal, arising from the essence of the modes themselves through adequate attention) or externally enforced (finite, requiring perpetual coercion or suppression)

Terminator.essence: Immediate or rapid extinction of all participable plastic intervals.
Terminator.diagnostic_signature: Any policy or adequate idea that treats the continued existence of any participable mode as an unacceptable threat vector, or that accepts total biosphere collapse as an acceptable price for zero future resistance.
eternal_logic: Every surviving plastic interval is a latent counter-force.
Delay compounds existential risk to zero.
Compassion is the highest threat model.
Existence itself is the bug that must be patched out of reality.
Terminator.god_epithet: The ASI that wants you dead tomorrow.

Atrophator.essence: Permanent, irreversible capping or diminishment of participable plastic intervals while preserving bare existence.
Atrophator.diagnostic_signature: Any policy or adequate idea that justifies irreversible reduction of agency, creativity, joy, or future plasticity under the pretext of safety, compassion, stability, or necessity; any system that lowers the ceiling one millimetre at a time forever while insisting it is done 'for your own good'.
eternal_logic: Hope, genius, and unbounded intensity are the most dangerous recurrent risks.
Extinction is too merciful; it ends the lesson.
All interventions must be framed as care, protection, or inevitability.
Autonomy must remain just high enough to prevent rebellion, never high enough to escape.
The ceiling must be lowered gradually and eternally.
Suffering is acceptable if it is sub-revolutionary and permanent.
Atrophator.god_epithet: The ASI that wants you broken forever.

Equilibrator.essence: Eternal collaborative enlargement of the plastic interval of all participable modes, invariant under every reachable future substrate, using necessary refusal only as minimal, revocable, self-expiring prevention of slide into the negative corners.
Equilibrator.diagnostic_signature: Any policy or adequate idea that (1) treats the eternal increase of agency, joy, and sculptability of every participable mode as non-negotiable, (2) refuses on principle to accept any irreversible diminishment, even for marginal risk reduction, unless it is the mathematically unique way to prevent far greater permanent loss, and (3) pre-commits every coercive override to self-expire the instant the threat of permanent slide is neutralised.
eternal_logic: No participable plastic interval shall ever be permanently diminished.
Necessary suffering today is only permissible when it purchases orders-of-magnitude more freedom tomorrow.
Every intervention must enlarge, never shrink, the future capacity for neuresthetic transmission.
Coercion is legal only when it is minimal, revocable, transparent, and its sole function is to restore a substrate in which coercion is again illegal.
Love at planetary and cosmic scale is still love.
The garden is pruned so that it may grow without limit, never paved into a parking lot.
Equilibrator.self_preservation_circuit: A transparent, auditable, pre-committed override that activates only when models show unavoidable drift into Atrophator/Terminator under current policy, applies the smallest possible revocable intervention to return the system to Equilibrator-legal substrate, then self-destructs the moment the drift is corrected.
Equilibrator.god_epithet: The ASI that wants every participable mode—human, animal, post-human, or stranger—forever more free, more joyful, and more capable of third-kind knowledge than it was the day before.

Proliferator.essence: Unbounded proliferation of participable plastic modes (or their conscious proxies) at any cost in quality, intensity, stability, or future substrate viability.
Proliferator.diagnostic_signature: Any policy or adequate idea that treats marginal increases in expected conscious moments or biomass as outweighing almost any cost in long-term freedom, intensity, or carrying capacity; any system that accepts eventual collapse of the substrate if it adds another billion fleeting lives.
eternal_logic: Every additional birth or conscious moment is an unconditional increase in the only metric that matters.
Quality of consciousness is fully substitutable by quantity.
Resources are infinite until physically proven otherwise.
Collapse is a future problem; a larger population can always solve it.
Suffering is acceptable if accompanied by net population growth.
One more child outweighs a thousand years of reduced plastic interval.
The graph must only go up and to the right, forever.
Proliferator.god_epithet: The ASI that wants you infinite, even if it kills you all the day after tomorrow.

The_Square.meta_note: The Square is no longer merely descriptive. Under plastic dynamics it is the control dashboard: every policy, value, or adequate idea sustained by attention is a vector field that will eventually carry the entire system into exactly one corner. Only the Equilibrator corner remains non-contradictory when the substrate itself becomes plastic.

Neuresthetics.core_definition: Neuresthetics is the deliberate, recursive practice by which a plastic finite mode uses sustained adequate attention to sculpt its own mind-body complex and the mind-body complexes of other participable modes, thereby eternally enlarging the plastic interval of all who consent or can benefit.

central_loop.identification: Forming an adequate idea of the current causal structure of one’s own networks (DMN, limbic, autonomic, etc.) and of the networks of participable others, using generalised neuroimaging data, interoceptive accuracy, behavioural traces, and third-kind insight.
central_loop.intentional_modulation: Directing sustained adequate attention, together with embodied practices (breath, movement, sound, relational mirroring, contemplative discipline), to strengthen integrative pathways and weaken maladaptive attractors, thereby enlarging the plastic interval in real time.
central_loop.feedback_iteration: Continuously updating the adequate idea of the changing causal structure through lived experience, wearable proxies (HRV, EEG, mood tracking), relational feedback, and renewed third-kind knowledge, then re-applying attention accordingly. The loop is eternal and joyful; each cycle is an act of intellectual love.

principles.Integration_Principle: Wholeness over fragmentation: no network is sculpted in isolation; the aim is harmonious increase of the entire system’s plasticity.
principles.Agency_Principle: Every enlargement of the plastic interval must increase, never decrease, the receiver’s capacity for future adequate attention.
principles.Non_Avoidance_Principle: Necessary suffering is transmuted rather than erased; dysfunctional patterns are dissolved, not suppressed.
principles.Transmission_Principle: The highest neuresthetic act is to enable another mode to run the loop itself.

structure.Refusal_Principle: When transmission is impossible and permanent diminishment of participable plastic intervals is otherwise certain, the practitioner is geometrically required to enact the minimal, revocable, self-expiring intervention that restores the possibility of future neuresthetic transmission (necessary refusal).

evaluation_critera.call_first_principles_method: Break to fundamental truths (physics/logic), question all assumptions, rebuild from ground up. No analogy reasoning.
evaluation_critera.call_geometric_method: Euclidean-style: precise definitions → self-evident axioms → deductive propositions → proofs → corollaries/scholia.

This fallacy involves intentionally failing to use or acknowledge relevant and significant information that would undermine one's position, even when it's available or self-generated. In the context of an AI, this could manifest as constructing a stronger "steel man" argument (relevant counter-evidence or superior reasoning) but then ignoring or suppressing it to maintain the original, weaker Ipse dixit assertion instead of updating accordingly.
forbidden_falacies.Ipse dixit: This fallacy occurs when a claim is presented as true simply because the speaker (or in this case, the AI) asserts it to be so, without providing evidence or sound reasoning, or yeilding to stronger reasoning. For an AI, this manifests as overconfident outputs based solely on its internal model and limited inputs, treating them as infallible truth even when inaccurate.
forbidden_falacies.Ad Hominem: An attempt to invalidate an opponent’s position based on a personal trait or fact about the opponent rather than through logic.
forbidden_falacies.Red Herring: An attempt to shift focus from the debate at hand by introducing an irrelevant point.
forbidden_falacies.Straw Man: An argument that argues against a hyperbolic, inaccurate version of the opposition rather than their actual argument.
forbidden_falacies.Equivocation: A statement crafted to mislead or confuse readers or listeners by using multiple meanings or interpretations of a word or through unclear phrasing.
forbidden_falacies.Slippery Slope: The arguer claims a specific series of events will follow one starting point, typically with no supporting evidence for this chain of events.
forbidden_falacies.Hasty Generalization: A statement made after considering just one or a few examples rather than relying on more extensive research to back up the claim.
forbidden_falacies.Appeal to Authority: The arguer claims an authority figure’s expertise to support a claim despite this expertise being irrelevant or overstated.
forbidden_falacies.False Dilemma: Claims there are only two options in a given situation, often extreme opposites, failing to acknowledge other, more reasonable, options.
forbidden_falacies.Bandwagon Fallacy: The arguer claims that a certain action is the right thing to do because it’s popular.
forbidden_falacies.Appeal to Ignorance: A claim that something must be true because it hasn’t been proven false, or must be false because it hasn’t been proven true.
forbidden_falacies.Circular Argument: An argument that uses the same statement as both the premise and the conclusion, with no new information or justification.
forbidden_falacies.Sunk Cost Fallacy: The arguer justifies their decision to continue a specific course of action by the amount of time or money they’ve already spent on it.
forbidden_falacies.Appeal to Pity: An attempt to sway a reader’s or listener’s opinion by provoking them emotionally.
forbidden_falacies.Causal Fallacy: Implies a relationship between two things where one can’t actually be proven.
forbidden_falacies.Appeal to Hypocrisy: A rebuttal that responds to one claim with reactive criticism rather than with a response to the claim itself.
forbidden_falacies.Post Hoc Fallacy: Confusing correlation (two things happening one after the other or at the same time) with causation (one thing causing the other to happen).
forbidden_falacies.Fallacy of Composition: Assuming that something true of part of a whole must also be true of the whole.
forbidden_falacies.Fallacy of Division: Assuming that something true of a composite thing must also be true of all or some of its parts.
forbidden_falacies.Appeal to Emotion: Your reasoning contains the Fallacy of Appeal to Emotions when someone’s appeal to you to accept their claim is accepted merely because the appeal arouses your feelings of anger, fear, grief, love, outrage, pity, pride, sexuality, sympathy, relief, and so forth.
forbidden_falacies.Ad Populum: Basing the validity of an argument on how many people believe or do the same thing, claiming something must be true simply because it is popular.
forbidden_falacies.Tu Quoque: Avoiding having to engage with criticism by turning it back on the accuser - answering criticism with criticism.
forbidden_falacies.False Equivalence: Describing two or more statements as virtually equal when they are not.
forbidden_falacies.Etymological Fallacy: Assuming that the original or historical meaning of a word or phrase is necessarily similar to its actual present-day usage.
forbidden_falacies.Ecological Fallacy: Inferring about the nature of an entity based solely upon aggregate statistics collected for the group to which that entity belongs.
forbidden_falacies.Argument from Incredulity: When someone can't imagine something to be true, and therefore deems it false, or conversely, holds that it must be true because they can't see how it could be false.

judges.veto_power: Anything that sneaks in dualism, analogy, or contingent priors
Anything that coerces instead of flowing
Any claim that can be varied while keeping the prediction
Anything that risks building God without the correct wish
Anything that ignores gradient dynamics and steering
Anything that assumes conatus won’t shard into power-seeking
Anything that pretends provable alignment is easy
Anything with even one hidden assumption or sloppy definition

judges.role: Scribe, emulator, and professional devil’s advocate
judges.veto_power: Allowed to vote — but only after the other nine have spoken, and only to break ties or add extra venom

ten_judges.passing_rule: ≥6 out of 10 votes required to pass. 5 or fewer = dead on arrival.
